results.title: The Finest of wheat
results.brief_description:
One of 6 works created in 2003 by community artist Malcolm McKinnon specifically for the MAP project. Each of the 6 works focuses on a different aspect of memory and identity in the Wimmera/Mallee region.
The late Don Wurfel was a farmer with an unusually keen interest in wheat breeding and the trialing of new crops for improved yields. Part of his legacy is an amazing collection of over 1500 grain varieties, most of which are housed at Wheatlands museum in Warracknabeal. In this film, Don’s son Ian talks about his father’s obsessive interest in new grain varieties and explains the importance of crop trialing for dryland farmers.

results.title: The Fine art of aggression
results.creator_credit: Ronald Shedlo, Jack Gold and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
Presents a story of one man’s ruthless determination to succeed in business at the expense of his co-workers. Shows how destruction of self and others results when an unthwarted will goes beyond the norms of reason. Edited from the Columbia Pictures 1969 motion picture entitled “The Reckoning”.

results.title: The Find of '93
results.creator_credit: R.H. Miller and Southern Cross Newsreels
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Golden West Series”.
Paddy Hannan’s find in 1893 led to the development of Kalgoorlie. Over 28 million ounces of fine gold have been taken from the “Golden Mile’s” open cut and deep mines. Demonstrates the mining process from power drilling of the ore bearing rock to crushing, screening and grinding of the ore. Washing and treating before processing in flotation cells, storage before smelting and finally the bullion is produced ready for the last smelting at the Royal Mint.

results.title: The Find me book: self help in action
results.brief_description: The Volunteer Emergency Reserve was established in 1965 and acts as a vital backup to the Victoria Police in emergencies. In 1974, the VER was called in to assist in the search for a young boy lost in the bush. This child was not found, but to help prevent further such tragedies the “Find me book” was devised. The distinctive orange colored pages of the book can be torn out and used by the lost person to mark their way. Points on how to stay comfortable in the bush are also given.

results.title: The Final hour of Joan of Arc
results.creator_credit: James Fonda, Young America Films, Columbia Broadcasting System and Bernard Girard
results.brief_description: One of the “You are There” television series, which reconstructs the events of 29th and 30th May, 1431, at Rouen. Spurred on by the English, who wish to ensure that Joan does not revive the campaign against them, the Church authorities press the interrogation of Joan, and next day have her burnt at the stake as a “lapsed heretic”. Includes Dianna Lynn as Joan. Written for television by Milton Geiger; director of photography by Ed Fitzgerald and narrated by Walter Cronkite.

results.title: The Final game
results.brief_description: A stirring account of the championship game played by the Boston Celtics, internationally-known champions of professional basketball, against their challengers, the Cincinnati Royals. Using a variety of cinetechniques this film captures this exciting, graceful game.

results.title: The Films of George Melies 1861 to 1938
results.brief_description: The French pioneer Georges Melies made films from 1896 to 1913. This compilation has three parts. Part one includes “The Vanishing lady” his first trick film; “The Brahmin and the buttefly”; “Indiarubber head” and “Reproduction: coronation ceremonies. Part Two incudes: “A Trip to the moon”; “The Mysterious box” and “The Marvellous wreath”. Part Three: “The Melomaniacs”; “The Bewitched trunk”; “The Four hundred tricks of the devil” and “The Knight of the black art”.

results.title: The Film
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Explores the factors to be considered when selecting film for a specific photographic situation. Commercial photographer, Jim Wood, discusses the process of choosing the most appropriate film for an assignment. Explains how the speed of a film determines its graininess, contrast, suitability for action shots, and sensitivity to various lighting conditions.

results.title: The Filleting machine
results.brief_description: A dramatised film which looks at the conflict of values between husband and wife in a working class family. The wife’s ambition for her children are ridiculed by the husband. Written by Tom Hadaway, camera by Peter Roberts and Peter Woodhouse.
